intro: Echinophora flabellifolia, commonly known as the fan-leaved thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is often found in rocky or dry soils. Its distinctive foliage and showy inflorescence make it a notable species in its native habitat. Echinophora flabellifolia is typically perennial and can grow up to 1 meter in height.
